title: Ticket #6159: Keep GridJobId in in job ad on completion and removal
description:
For many scheduler types, when a grid universe job enters a terminal state (COMPLETED or REMOVED), the gridmanager clears the GridJobId attribute in the job ad. This makes it impossible to know where the job ran by looking at the history file. We should change it so that GridJobId is preserved when a job leaves the queue.

Original Feature Request

Currently, when the Gridmanager sees that a job it's been tracking has completed, it clears out the GridJobId attribute. This makes it difficult to troubleshoot issues that have occurred with jobs in the past. Could we store the previous GridJobId in a classad attribute, say LastGridJobId?
remarks:
2020-Aug-18 16:05:01 by jfrey:
There's also a bug in mark_idle() (executed on schedd startup) that can cause the schedd to not remove a REMOVED grid job from the queue if GridJobId is set. The function needs to also check whether Managed is set to ScheddDone. The effects of this are minor, as the job will leave the queue the next time job policy expressions are evaluated.
